indications:
Indications 
(From 6.1.2.3 Other antidiabetic drugs: British National Formulary)
6.1.2.3 Other antidiabetic drugs
name: SAXAGLIPTIN
cautions:
Cautions elderly; determine
renal function before treatment and periodically thereafter; interactions: Appendix 1 (antidiabetics)
side-effects:
Side-effects vomiting, dyspepsia, gastritis; peripheral oedema;
headache, dizziness, fatigue; upper respiratory tract infection, urinary
tract infection, gastroenteritis, sinusitis, nasopharyngitis; hypoglycaemia,
myalgia; less commonly dyslipidaemia, hypertriglyceridaemia,
erectile dysfunction, arthralgia; also reported rash
doses:
adult over 18 years, 5 mg
once daily

Dose of concomitant sulfonylurea may need
to be reduced
pregnancy: Pregnancy avoid unless essential—toxicity in animal studies
